str2: In like manner, similarly, in the same way, equally. Adverb from homoios; similarly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From hupo and tasso; to subordinate; reflexively, to obey.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To clothe oneself (originally: To tie round in a knot).
Humility, lowliness of mind, modesty. From a compound of tapeinos and the base of phren; humiliation of mind, i.e. Modesty.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From anti and the middle voice of tasso; to range oneself against, i.e. Oppose.
Proud, arrogant, disdainful. From huper and phaino; appearing above others, i.e. haughty.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
Humble, lowly, in position or spirit (in a good sense). Of uncertain derivation; depressed, i.e. humiliated.
